alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 11:10PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Garvin, northern Grady, eastern Oklahoma, southwestern Lincoln, Cleveland, Pottawatomie and McClain Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1110 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wellston to near Norman to 5 miles north of Bradley. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, Norman, eastern Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Shawnee, Del City, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Tecumseh, Purcell, Chandler, Choctaw, Noble, Tuttle, Harrah, Slaughterville, McLoud and Spencer. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 81 and 120. Interstate 40 between mile markers 155 and 194. Interstate 44 between mile markers 81 and 113, and between mile markers 139 and 167. Interstate 240 between mile markers 7 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie
